Contradict fact: The claim that the United States' involvement in Syria was originally supposed to last "30 days" contradicts the statements of experts who have stated that they have never heard of such a plan.
Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration since it suggests that the majority of ISIS fighters captured in Syria are from Europe without providing sufficient evidence or data to support this assertion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any specific evidence or data to back up the statement that the majority of ISIS fighters captured in Syria are from Europe.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the thousands of ISIS fighters captured in Syria can be categorized as "mostly from Europe" without providing any basis or justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the origin of the ISIS fighters captured in Syria, such as fighters from other regions or countries outside of Europe.
